Posts.Content: Jan 15, 2012 07:04PM dawns_sunrise wrote: Thank you Anne. That's a good reminder and one I've been working on getting figured out.  I still don't have that answer.  I do lean towards (I like you word, nicer than mine) hypervigilance, and I'm aware of that and try to fight it.  Again, thank you, it's something I need to hear. Okay, my appointment is tomorrow morning for the diagnostic mammogram.  Crazy to be feeling nervous because it won't tell me anything right away, but I am.  Just have to remember this is another step, and that I have my appointment to figure out the next step on Thursday.
Posts.Title: What I think scares me most (at least currently.) dawns_sunrise dawns_sunrise

Posts.Content: Jan 15, 2012 08:12AM dawns_sunrise wrote: Thank you both.  Flash-I'm smiling now, because that's exactly what my CNP said.   Depending on the results of the mammogram she'd send me to a derm next. I kinda understood that reasoning, but it's good to hear you explain it more. Cycle-path- yes,thank you.  That's what I'm trying to do.  I'm trying to sort through the millions of crazy thoughts and find the basics of them, the really important ones.  Sometimes it takes saying the same thing many times to the same or a few different people, but in the end if it gets me to where I have the questions to go for the answers I need, then it's worth it to me and hopefully anyone I make listen.
Posts.Title: What I think scares me most (at least currently.) dawns_sunrise dawns_sunrise

Posts.Content: Jan 20, 2012 05:10PM dawns_sunrise wrote: Hi,  sorry, I'm a day late on when I said I'd pot an update.  Had my mammogram on the 16th, that came back clear (although it was weird feeling to have my CNP, looking at the report going, benign, benign, benign, when what they'd told me was just that it was clear.)  I asked her about getting an ultrasound, and she would write the rx for that, (great suggestion SpecialK,) but first we're going with the dermatologist.  That's the way she is leaning and I feel either fork is an acceptable one to take.  I can always walk back and explore the other too.  She told me that nursing can change the texture and color, but I've not really heard that before.  If it's true they should make it more common knowledge.   Anyway, we're also going to treat as though I have thrush.  Some of the pain I'm feeling is less, but the same as when my ob/gyn treated me for that.  Of course as a friend pointed out, if I"ve had it for that long, it's going to be hard to get rid of.  Going to see the derm next Thursday to talk about the nipple discoloration and skin itchiness.   Okay, I think that's my update.  Thanks for reading.   Dawn
Posts.Title: What I think scares me most (at least currently.) dawns_sunrise dawns_sunrise
